R. Hawes.

The undersigned were jurors who tried the case of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against William Jones & Jack Davis on a charging for uttering & passing counterfeit money at the October Term 1858 of the Bourbon circuit court, where was found them both guilty & fixed the punishment of each to confinement in the penitentiary for the term of six years. We were satisfied from all the proof and the circumstances in the case that Jones was a practiced & veteran Rascal & that Davis was a novice & the dupe & victim of Davis Jones. We believe that it was about Daviss beginning in the career of crime -- we think he has been punished enough & ask this court to remit this residue of Davis time

Valentine Heldseth
David M. Dodge.
Tho. L. Arnold.
W B Rogers
J. H. Boulden
Jesh Duncan
F. Hardesty
Thos Stone
H. W. Lotton
J. L. Becrafts
C. C. Skillman
W G Kenney Commonwealths witnes
O. H. Burbridge

I defended Wm Jones & Jack G. Davis on their trial as setforth in the above statement. I have the same opinion as to their guilt as that expressed by the jurors in their said statement & unite with them in asking the Governor to remit the residue of Davis^'s^ term
